text: Asaph Hall III (October 15, 1829 â€“ November 22, 1907) was an American astronomer. He is best known for having discovered the two moons of Mars, Deimos and Phobos, in 1877. He found the orbits of satellites of other planets and of double stars. He also found the rotation of Saturn and the mass of Mars. ==References== Category:American astronomers Category:Moons of Mars Category:Scientists from Connecticut Category:1829 births Category:1907 deaths
title: Asaph Hall
